title: Chartly Canonical Event (v1)
description: A canonical Event represents a timestamped occurrence emitted by ingestion, normalization, or domain systems. Events are traceable to raw inputs via raw_ref and scoped by tenant and source.

event_type.description: Event type discriminator (e.g., ingest.started, ingest.failed, domain.price_updated).

ts.description: RFC3339 timestamp when the event occurred.

source_id.description: Source identifier that produced or is associated with this event.

raw_ref.description: Reference to immutable raw input that supports traceability.

sha256.description: SHA-256 hex digest of the raw payload.

content_type.description: MIME content type of the raw payload.

captured_at.description: RFC3339 capture time for the raw payload.

size_bytes.description: Optional raw payload size in bytes.
